pageContext.claim: “Your coal miners are coming back like never before, you know that, they were -- they were out of business, but if I didn't win, they were out of business, there would be no more coal taken out of the ground.”
pageContext.analysis: As of August, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, 53,100 coal miners were employed, a gain of 2,400, or 4.6 percent, under Trump. But that still fewer than the number a year before his inauguration — and a far cry from the 89,700 employed in January 2012.
